definition: to warn/to urge/to exhort/to give instructions carefully and insistently
to sting or bite (of mosquito, bee etc)/to say repeatedly/to urge insistently/to ask repeatedly/to stick to a point/(onom.) tinkling or jingling sound

sentences.english: On the first day of school, a mother taking her child to school worriedly repeats her instructions.
sentences.chinese: 开学第一天，送小孩上学的妈妈不放心地殷殷叮咛。

sentences.english: The doctor says that Grace must lie down and rest for a short time every afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 医生叮咛葛瑞丝每天下午必须躺下来休息片刻。

sentences.english: Eg. The mother bade the child behave himself.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈叮咛孩子要守规矩。

sentences.english: The mother bade the child behave himself.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈叮咛孩子要守规矩。

sentences.english: You only one of dongfeng, summon up my courage to move forward.
sentences.chinese: 您浩荡东风般的叮咛，鼓起我前进的勇气。

sentences.english: It seems that someone is whispering in her ears, protecting her at all times.
sentences.chinese: 似乎有人一直在她耳边殷殷叮咛，时时保护着她。

sentences.english: Can't forget your mighty hands of dongfeng, summon up my courage to move forward.
sentences.chinese: 忘不了您浩荡东风般的叮咛，鼓起我前进的勇气。

sentences.english: In addition, it reminds you of the special points you should be aware of.
sentences.chinese: 并且叮咛您在写作上应需特别注意哪些事项。

sentences.english: Every word and every phrase can be an encouragement and exhortation to his son.
sentences.chinese: 每一字每一句都带着对孩子的深切叮咛。

definition: urgently/eagerly/worried/(urge sb to) be sure to/it is absolutely essential to (follow the above instruction)
to chat with a low voice
on leaving/on the point of departure
to be chattersome/to talk on and on without stopping/to nag
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
to worry about/to be concerned about
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
